column4: Hi, there.  I'm having trouble with my ssh client.  It doesn't display some window-drawing extended ascii characters properly.
http://www.asciitable.com/ shows some codes.  For instance, number 196 is a vertical table line.  It shows up as little a with an hat (accent ague?). :(
consider your shell as the issue rather than the SSH client
What does my shell have to do with it?
um... my ssh client is displaying the program that is displaying those characters (tmux or elinks in this case).
okay.  What should I expect?  I see LANG=en_US.UTF-8
my ssh client is displaying, you're referring to x forwarding?
Where should I look for help with putty for Windows?
I was hoping it would be a $TERM issue or something :(
I guess I should see if putty for linux has the same issue...
putty has a bunch of settings for that. Look through the setting window
